titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the English Documents Collection, 1552-1875
titlestmt.author: Inventory prepared by Archives and Special Collections Library, Vassar College Libraries

publicationstmt.publisher: Archives and Special Collections Library, Vassar College Libraries

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by Elizabeth Clarke April 2007

did.head: Collection Summary
did.physdesc: 15 cubic feet (325 items in 15 boxes and 6 mapcase drawers)

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Archives and Special Collections Library, Vassar College Libraries

did.abstract: Deeds, leases, apprenticeship indentures rent rolls, wills, customs certificates and other legal documents, mostly from Devon, Kent and Somerset.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Deeds, leases, apprenticeship indentures rent rolls, wills, customs certificates and other legal documents, mostly from Devon, Kent and Somerset.
A list created in 1979 mentions a "1551 court roll, Shrubwell, Buttscombe & L, Somerset," but it has either been mislabeled or mislaid as of March 2014.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research according to the regulations of the Vassar College Archives and Special Collections Librarywithout any additional restrictions.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Permission to quote (publish) from unpublished or previously published material must be obtained as described in the regulations of the Vassar College Archives and Special Collections Library.

odd.head: Encoding Information
odd.p: Updated by Laura Streett/Streett, February 2008 and March 2014.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: According to a collection inventory (completed presumably by Nat Alcock in 1979), the material was "apparently bought in London in 1938, and presented to the College thereafter, by a faculty member." However, according to a 1967 list of manuscript collections at Vassar, compiled by librarian Frances Goudy, the collection was a gift of Dorothy Meigs Eidlitz, Vassar Class of 1914.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: English Documents Collection, Archives and Special Collections Library, Vassar College Libraries.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is intellectually arranged in seven series, and chronologically within each of those series. It is physically arranged according to the size of the document.

SERIES VI. CUSTOMS BONDS AND CERTIFICATES
Customs Bond from Reign of Charles II,
License and customs agreement signed by Thomas Wills and Robert Black regarding the export of wool to London from Barnstaple, Devon,
Request for Ann Bussel to appear in court as a witness in the trial of Edward [Hurfe?] for "felonious stealing of half a crowne from her," Cadleigh, Devon,
Agreement to sell, Philip Hooper from Anthony Eveleigh, Farrington, Devon [now Sowton],

Accounts received for Arthur Farwell in Ashburton and Totnes, Devon,
1734 copy 12 January 1733 document regarding the bankrupcy and creditors of John Anstey of Tiverton, Devon,
Fine – Milton Abbot & Ermington, Stephen Maddaford, pl. ; John& Mary Prout, John & Sarah Hawkins – 2 Mess, 3 gdns, 20 ac. Land, 4 ac. Mead., 2 ac. Pasture, Devon,

File of lawyers a/cs – Mr Henry Beavis to P.M. Docton. Esq., Barnstaple, Devon,

Copy, fine re manor of Torre, Devon, Baron Cliffor of Chudleigh and Charles Butler, Esq., plaintiffs,
Calculation of value of manors of Maristow, Buckland, Monachorum, Bickleigh, Shaugh Prior, Walkhampton, Devon from printed particulars of rents,
Letter from the new Bishop of Exeter to Mr. [Francis] Freeling about his franking priviledge,
Terms of a survey on behalf of Richard Berryman for letting land to farm Trillacot, North Petherwin, Devon,
Court Citation to Mrs. Frances (Fanny) Pellatt, regarding the estate of her late husband, Henry Pellatt, Canterbury,
Check for wages for John Teague who served in the Navy aboard the Prince and the Trent, and died 1798. Check issued to his sister Letitia Teague, Plymouth, Devon,
Shares in the the Little Duke Copper Mine in Tavistock, Devon,
Affidavits regarding the July 1816 fire in Buckfastleigh, Devon,
Affidavit of Reverend Matthew Lowndes regarding the July 1816 fire in Buckfastleigh, Devon,
Return of people liable for militia service, including 63 names, ages and occupations, Bardninch, Devon,
Pedigree of the Turner Family of Cadbury, Devon,
Chancery Court document regarding a survey of an estate in Cadbury, Devon, possibly owned by John Pitt,
Letter to William Drew, Esq., London, from someone whose mother has just died in Exeter,
Document regarding tolls and repairs for the roads from Tavistock to Morwellham, Devon,

Stock certificates from the Cawson Hill Copper, Lead and Tin Mining Company, Devon, owned by Matthew Johnston,
Letter by James Thomson, architect and surveyor, describing the West Hoe Estate at Plymouth as a potential building site,
Letter from Reverend Owen Lucas O'Neil, Cornworthy Vicarage, Totnes, Devon,
Letter from "Dippertown Office" regarding land at Lewtrenchard belonging to Parson Gould,
Receipt, payment for house in Deptford, Kent,
Agreement between [Clement Tipp?] and John Kingsford of Canterbury,
"Mortgage agreement of William Barnes, Boughton, Kent"

Decl. by Thomas Babb, appointing wife Charlotte to act – relates to Barnstaple group,
